content.description: SDS with small 3 finger crimp for left and jug for right. Move into slopey pinch for left hand and heel hook the start hold of Tall Dark and Beefy to gain the face. Top out straight up. Same finish as tall dark beefy.
content.location: Just left of Tall dark and Beefy. About 50 ft right of Bilingual.

content.description: SDS just left of Dual. Crux moves off the ground on a small overhang lead to a juggy left leaning diagonal. Follow this up into smaller holds and to a good/casual top out to the left.
content.location: Just left of dual. Or In between Vitamin B and Dual.

content.description:
In The Cut:  

  On the listening Rock Trail, walk past the top, first lookout and continue around to the stone stairway.    when the small set of stone stairs is reached, walk off the trail to the right and hug the rock formations. to the left, the boulders should cut back in, forming a shady, private, roomy area. there should be a tall vertical wall, and then to the other side of the small area there should be an overhanging face with an deep pit-like landing...    in this area, to find "Dual" look for the only place to climb up to chalk the top out. it will be a wedged slab of diagonal stone you have to scramble up onto.    dual is just to the left and climbs up the "Dual" cracks to the top, which is lower and not nearly as highball as its neighbors to the left.    Sit-start as low as your arms will span apart while in the cracks at the bottom. past feet, and follow these crack-lines to the top-out. you can use any holds in-between the crack-lines as well. top out straight above the start. the top out is solid.
content.location: On the listening Rock Trail, walk past the top, first lookout and continue around to the stone stairway.    when the small set of stone stairs is reached, walk off the trail to the right and hug the rock formations. to the left, the boulders should cut back in, forming a shady, private, roomy area. there should be a tall vertical wall, and then to the other side of the small area there should be an overhanging face with an deep pit-like landing...    in this area, to find "Dual" look for the only place to climb up to chalk the top out. it will be a wedged slab of diagonal stone you have to scramble up onto.    dual is just to the left and climbs up the "Dual" cracks to the top, which is lower and not nearly as highball as its neighbors to the left.    Sit-start as low as your arms will span apart while in the cracks at the bottom.

content.description:
Located in The Cut:  

  This Problem starts in the same location as "Dual" (V0/1) and climbs up only the left crack line.    Sit-start on the left crack line and ascend that individual crack-line up, useing only existing/attached holds and finger locks along that crack to gain the top out above.
content.location: Walk past the stone stairs and hug the rock formations past it. there will be a shady alcove room like area to you left with a featured, lofty highball wall and some Rhododendron trees in it. look for the two side by side crack lines at arms width apart. this problem concentrates only on the left crack line.    This Problem starts in the same location as "Dual" (V0/1) and climbs up only the left crack line.

content.description: SDS in the hole with left foot on good ledge and right in the crack. Pull off the ground with opposing gastons, and into a sloper, crimps, and an undercling before hitting the top out jug. Slightly overhanging.
content.location: About 50 ft past Bi-lingual in a dark corner. Hole just right of Dual.

content.description: The Abyss Wall is fantastic! It has everything from V-0 to  V-project on it. This long strip of vertical to overhung face is VERY close to the parking lot and has plenty of lofty top outs for one & all. Don't miss the easy going "Crash" and the fun and challenging "Abyss" and right around the corner (same section of cliff but more noticeable and called called the "front wall") are the "Strength of One" problems, among many others! There are patches of moss all over the faces here, but all the cleaning that ever needs to be done HAS been done. Please dont brush anything be established holds... dont be that guy/girl who closes the park!
